Computer Systems based on Z80 Family

If there are popular computer systems based on Z80 family, you know of or you would like to point to, please tell me. Please also inform me about updates, broken or missing links, etc.

MICROBEE

In Australia there was a Z80A computer manufactured called the Microbee.
It came out as the Microbee 16, then Microbee 32, Microbee 56, Microbee Computer-in-a-book, Microbee 128, Microbee 128 Premium and Microbee 256TC.
The early ones used Cassette, then 3.5" floppies and some had Hard Drives.
Early ones booted to Basic while later ones used CP/M 2.2 with graphical shell.
  • Microbee Software Preservation Project (MSPP)

Morrow MicroDecision MD-3, MD-6, MD-11, MD-60

  • Sorry, nothing yet! ask Joel Lichtenwalner

MSX

    MSX (MicroSoft eXtended) - Japanese computer, developed by more than 20 asiatic and european companies, like Philips, Sony, Toshiba, Panasonic, Mitsubishi, Daweoo, etc.
    Microsoft has a special part, they developed MSX-Basic 1.0 and MSX-DOS 1.0.

  • Very good place to start (*)
  • mail MSX Jeff Lodoen
  • MSX by Sean Young

Robotron

SEGA

  • Sega Genesis contains a Z80 processor. The main processor is a Motorola 68000 processor running at 8 Mhz, and it has a Z80 coprocessor to do background tasks such as audio among other things.
  • Sega Master System, the documents it's based on a zilog Z80 cpu running at 3.xx mhz.
Please also check out Game Machines based on Z80 Family.
